oai_dc:dc.dc:title: STABILITY AND IMPULSE RESPONSE OF EMPIRICAL EIGENFUNCTIONS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Winant, Clinton D.
Aubrey, David G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Eigenfunctions
impulse response
stability
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The statistical method of empirical eigenfunctions has been applied to four years of beach profile data. The eigenfunctions associated with the three largest eigenvalues are shown to be stable for data sets of one, two, three, and four years length, and they correctly describe beach changes caused by storm activity. The usefulness of the eigenfunction representation is confirmed as a concise means of representing beach profile variability.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 15 (1976): Proceedings of 15th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Honolulu, Hawaii, 1976.; 76
